page.title: 07Oilseed Rape Production
page.content: Pioneered as a crop by a local seed merchant,oil was largely used for lubrication but poisonous substance now bred out and new varieties produce oil for margarine and cooking oil with the advantages of high boiling point and runs off fried food easily.The crop suffers from flea and pollen beetle.Sprayed, formerly from the air but protests from Bee keepers led to the development of insecticide harmless to bees.Now ground spraying avoiding critical flowering time.Harvested either by spraying to kill greenery and then combined,or swathed,cutting a 9" stalk and left for a week lying to dry off leaves,then combined with a Rape pick-up head.Can be a problem to combine directly.Also harvesting must be done before the before the pods pop.Yields !.5 tons per acre.
